ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and no one will shackle as He shackles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And none can bind as He will bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and Allah will bind as none other can bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: And His bonds will be such as none other can bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And no one binds like He does!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And none will bind as He will bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And no one shall bind with (anything like) His binding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: none shall bind as He binds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: None bindeth as He then will bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and none can bind with bonds like His!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor shall any bind with His bond.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and none shall bind as He binds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And none will bind as He will bind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nor will any bind as He binds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And none will shackle as He shackles.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [89:26] and, likewise, none shall bind (read yūthiqu) His bind (a variant reading has yu‘adhdhabu, ‘[none] shall be chastised’, and yūthaqu, ‘[none] shall be bound’, so that the [suffixed] pronoun of ‘adhābahu and wathāqahu refers to the [chastisement and the binds of the] disbeliever, the meaning then being, ‘none shall be chastised as he shall, and none shall be bound as he shall [be bound]’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (None bindeth as He then will bind) this can also be understood to mean: none punishes like this and none will inflict that kind of punishment except Allah.
